Sentencas: Conventional solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs) could suffer from carbon deposition when fueled with hydrocarbons.
Titulo: Modeling of all-porous solid oxide fuel cells with a focus on the electrolyte porosity design

Sentencas: For comparison, a new type of SOFC with porous electrolyte can resist carbon deposition because it allows oxygen molecules to transport from the cathode to the anode.
Titulo: Modeling of all-porous solid oxide fuel cells with a focus on the electrolyte porosity design

Sentencas: As the transport of O-2 to the anode lowers the fuel cell performance and causes the risk of explosion, the rate of O-2 transport must be well controlled to ensure efficient and safe operation.
Titulo: Modeling of all-porous solid oxide fuel cells with a focus on the electrolyte porosity design

Sentencas: Following our previous model, this paper focuses on electrolyte porosity optimization under various inlet methane mole fractions, inlet oxygen mole fractions and inlet gas flow rates.
Titulo: Modeling of all-porous solid oxide fuel cells with a focus on the electrolyte porosity design

Sentencas: Furthermore, a new design with a partial porous electrolyte is proposed and numerically evaluated.
Titulo: Modeling of all-porous solid oxide fuel cells with a focus on the electrolyte porosity design

Sentencas: The new design significantly improves the electrochemical performance compared with all-porous one.
Titulo: Modeling of all-porous solid oxide fuel cells with a focus on the electrolyte porosity design

Sentencas: A conversion rate >90% from methane to syngas is achieved at the 0.33 inlet CH4 mole fraction with the new design.
Titulo: Modeling of all-porous solid oxide fuel cells with a focus on the electrolyte porosity design

Sentencas: The results enhance the understanding of all porous solid oxide fuel cells and the mechanism underlying, inspiring novel designs of solid oxide fuel cells.
Titulo: Modeling of all-porous solid oxide fuel cells with a focus on the electrolyte porosity design
